News and developments from Justia and the tech world -----
June 2020

Welcome to the June 2020 edition 
of the Justia client newsletter!

Get the latest scoop on online marketing, read our digest of legal and SEO news from the past month, and peek inside the doors at Justia to see what our team has been doing.

New! Justia Lawyer Directory Profile Compare & Save

Prospective clients can now compare and save attorney profiles while browsing the Justia Lawyer Directory. Be sure to make your directory profile as complete as possible by including your credentials, a high quality photo, peer & client reviews, payment options, contact information, and more, as prospective clients will use these new features to compare attorneys side-by-side.

Once a user has compared attorney profiles, they can save the ones they are most interested in. They can also see their recently viewed profiles so that they can return to them later to compare or save them. Read more here about how these features work, and complete your profile with high quality content about your practice and experience today!

Important Updates Regarding COVID-19

Laws and Legal Resources Related to Coronavirus

Stay up to date on the latest legal developments arising from the COVID-19 pandemic, including changes associated with employment law, evictions and foreclosures, business assistance, taxes, immigration, debts & bankruptcy, criminal proceedings, family law, and personal injury cases. We have also assembled 50-state resources on coronavirus and the law regarding the topics including the following:

• Coronavirus and Unemployment Benefits

• Eviction, Mortgage, & Foreclosure Relief During COVID-19

• Stay At Home Orders and State Reopening Plans

• COVID-19 & Taxes

• Elections During COVID-19

Featured News

Bar Exam Dates Modified, Some States Go Online Due to COVID-19

Many states have either postponed the July 2020 bar exam, expanded limited practice rules for recent graduates, or made plans to conduct the test online due to COVID-19 concerns.
Read More

Tech News

Google Could Face Antitrust Suits by Summer as DOJ, States Move Toward Decisions

Federal and state officials are reportedly moving toward initiating antitrust actions against Google after over a year of investigations into tech companies including Amazon and Apple.

Just Turning Your Phone On Qualifies as Searching It, Court Rules

A federal judge in Washington has concluded that FBI officials should have had a search warrant to look at the lock screen of a smartphone belonging to a criminal defendant.

Senate Passes Spying Bill Without Search and Browsing History Protections

In reauthorizing a Patriot Act-era surveillance law, the US Senate declined to include a provision shielding Americans’ browsing and search histories from warrantless FBI searches.

A Private Equity Firm is Blocked From Buying .Org

The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers, which oversees the Internet naming system, rejected a bid of more than $1 billion for the sale of the rights to dot-org.

Hendren Redwine & Malone, PLLC

in North Carolina, recently launched 
their Justia website:

hendrenmalone.com

SEO News

Here’s Why Optimizing Images In Google My Business Is Important

Uploading your own high-resolution, professional photos to your GMB listing instead of relying on user photos is one of the ways you can boost your listing’s effectiveness and appeal.

Google Launches New Podcast Promising Undocumented Information

A new podcast will reportedly feature information regarding some of what goes on behind the scenes at Google, along with discussion regarding future projects that are in the works.

How YouTube Ranks Suggested Videos

A research paper from Google illuminates how deep learning regarding user behavior and video optimization by creators impact the way suggested videos are ranked in YouTube.

Google Ads Shortens Business Identity Verification Time

Google has amended the identity verification time frame for businesses running Google Ads, giving them 21 days to submit documentation before they receive a 7-day warning.

Internet Stats

Proportion of Total Engaged Time Spent
on COVID-19 Articles

Source: Chartbeat

Tip: During the COVID-19 pandemic, people are consuming news at a very high rate. People are seeking the latest coronavirus news and useful resources. We recommend following the news and writing new coronavirus-related content that caters to your target audience.

Andrea Vacca of Vacca Family Law Group was quoted by the New York Times regarding the divorce process during pandemic

Christie Arkovich was quoted by CNBC regarding borrowers and the public service loan forgiveness program

Dennis Brager of Brager Tax Law Group was quoted by BankRate regarding the tax implications of a cash-out mortgage refinance

Did You Know?

GoDaddy Confirmed a Data Breach with 28,000 Customers Affected

GoDaddy recently confirmed a data breach on web hosting credentials for 28,000 customers. They note that the incident is limited in scope to the web hosting account and your main GoDaddy customer account was not accessed. You would only be affected if you use GoDaddy web hosting (if you have a Justia website, we host your site on our servers). That said, we recommend reviewing and updating your GoDaddy password to be on the safe side.
Learn More

Social Media News

Twitter Is Testing a Way to Let You Limit Replies to Your Tweets

Twitter is experimenting with giving users the ability to limit who can reply to their Tweets, which can include all users, only people they follow, or only people that they directly mention.

LinkedIn Now Factors ‘Dwell Time’ Into Its Algorithm

In order to offer users the content that is most valuable to them, LinkedIn is now integrating how long a user spends with a piece into its algorithm, along with likes and other interactions.

Facebook & Instagram Let Businesses Sell Products Directly on Their Page

New features including Facebook Shops and Instagram Shop aim to make e-commerce more seamless by allowing users to purchase products from within their social media accounts.

Facebook Says It Will Permanently Shift Tens of Thousands of Jobs to Remote Work

Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg stated that over the next five to ten years, he envisions a large proportion of the company shifting to remote work, starting with current open positions.

Inside Justia

Meet Our Team

Home Workspaces

Our team continues to work remotely due to COVID-19. Each of us has our own personalized home workspace where we can focus. Here is a peek at the workspaces of a designer, a Helpdesk support member, and an account manager.

A Pug’s Tale

Friends of Hug Pugs

Since our pugs are stuck at home sheltering in place, they wanted to introduce you to their work pal's pups! Meet Alejandra’s dog Kiwi, who is a wonderful reading pal :)

Legal Industry News

Texas Tries a Pandemic First: A Jury Trial By Zoom

A Collin County court convened a remote jury for a “summary jury trial” in which they would assemble via videoconference and deliver a non-binding verdict in an insurance dispute.

Managing Caseloads Remotely During Coronavirus

Tips for managing your firm’s workflow on a remote basis during the pandemic include embracing tech, outsourcing time-consuming tasks, and taking advantage of slow times.

Expanded Online Law Classes Could Continue Under Plan Endorsed by ABA Legal Ed Council

The ABA is considering revisions to a rule that limits the amount of online education that accredited law schools can offer so that these restrictions can be relaxed during emergencies.

Key Factors for Closing Transactions Remotely

Attorneys completing deals remotely due to the COVID-19 outbreak should be familiar with electronic signature options, and also be aware of requirements for things like notarization.
